intro: Obione spinifera, commonly known as the spiny sea hare, is a species of sea slug found in marine environments. It belongs to the family Aeolidiidae and is characterized by its distinctive spiny structures along its body. The plant-like appearance of the spiny sea hare is due to its ability to absorb and store pigments from its diet, which can vary in color. It is primarily found in shallow coastal waters and feeds on algae and other small organisms. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in marine ecosystems.
